basics.name: Jocelyn Kavanagh
basics.title: Academic Professional and Technical Director of the GT School of Music

work.name: Georgia Institute of Technology
work.position: Academic Professional, Technical Director of the School of Music
work.summary: Inventory and purchase technical equipment for student checkout. Supervise streaming and production of 60 concerts a year. Teach fundamental music technology coursework.
highlights: Intro to Audio Tech I, Technical Production, Guthman Musical Instrument Competition

volunteer.summary: Coordinate and schedule Georgia Tech's mascot appearance requests. Coach practices for mascot team twice a week.

education.area: Music Technology, minor in Computing and Media

awards.title: Provost Academic Excellence Award
awards.summary: The Provost Academic Excellence award is given to the graduating senior from each college that has the most outstanding scholastic effort.

awards.title: Kim Scott Logan Award
awards.summary: Highest honor given to a Music Technology student

awards.title: ADVANCE Women of Excellence Award
awards.summary: Award funded by the NSF recognizing individuals who have distinguished themselves through their leadership, scholarship, and service.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
